summary: Nix Flake Tailwind Source Concatenation Fix

content.text: I see you sent just a period. How can I help you today?
I'll help you fix the `cargo-leptos build` failure. Let me start by running the build command to see what error we're getting.

input.description: Run cargo-leptos build to see the error

content.text: The error shows that the `hydrate` feature is trying to include `leptos/hydrate`, but `leptos` is not listed as a dependency in Cargo.toml. Let me examine the Cargo.toml file to see what's missing.

file.content:
cargo-features = ["codegen-backend"]

[package]
name = "site"
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2021"

[package.metadata.leptos]
site-root = "target/site"
site-pkg-dir = "pkg"
style-file = "style/tailwind_out.css"
# Assets source dir. All files found here will be copied and synchronized to site-root. //NB: The assets-dir cannot have a sub directory with the same name/path as site-pkg-dir.
assets-dir = "public"

site-addr = "127.0.0.1:61156"
reload-port = 61157

# [Optional] Command to use when running end2end tests. It will run in the end2end dir.
#   [Windows] for non-WSL use "npx.cmd playwright test"
#   This binary name can be checked in Powershell with Get-Command npx
end2end-cmd = "npx playwright test"
end2end-dir = "end2end"

#  The browserlist query used for optimizing the CSS.
browserquery = "defaults"

env = "DEV" # "DEV" | "PROD"

bin-features = ["ssr"]
bin-default-features = false
lib-features = ["hydrate"]
lib-default-features = false

lib-profile-release = "wasm-release"

[package.metadata.cargo-all-features]
skip_feature_sets = [["ssr", "hydrate"]]

[dependenciesv]
color-eyre = "0.6.3"
derive-new = "0.7.0"
derive_more = { version = "2.0.1", features = ["from", "display", "deref", "deref_mut", "debug"] }
futures = "0.3.31"
leptos = { version = "0.7", features = ["nightly", "islands"] }
leptos-routable = "^0.1"
leptos_meta = { version = "0.7" }
leptos_router = { version = "0.7", features = ["nightly"] }
serde = { version = "1.0.219", features = ["derive"] }
v_utils = { version = "2.6.4", features = ["cli"] } #ga: rm path
web-sys = "0.3"

# optional-hydrate {{{
console_error_panic_hook = { version = "^0.1", optional = true }
wasm-bindgen = { version = "^0.2.100", optional = true } #NB: version must match that of wasm-bindgen-cli I'm compiling the project with
#,}}}

# optional-ssr {{{
axum = { version = "=0.7.9", optional = true }
chrono = { version = "^0.4.40", optional = true, features = ["serde"] }
chrono-tz = { version = "^0.10.3", optional = true }
clap = { version = "^4.5.32", features = ["derive"] }
leptos_axum = { version = "^0.7", optional = true }
plotly = { version = "^0.12.0", features = ["image", "kaleido"], optional = true }
reqwest = { version = "^0.12.15", optional = true }
serde_json = { version = "^1.0.140", optional = true }
serde_with = { version = "3.12.0", features = ["chrono"] }
tokio = { version = "^1", features = ["rt-multi-thread"], optional = true }
tracing = { version = "^0.1.41", optional = true }
v_exchanges = { version = "^0.6.7", features = ["binance", "bybit", "data"], optional = true } #ga: rm path
#,}}}

[features]
default = ["ssr", "hydrate"]
hydrate = [
    "leptos/hydrate",
    "dep:console_error_panic_hook",
    "dep:wasm-bindgen"
]
ssr = [
    "dep:serde_json",
    "dep:v_exchanges",
    "dep:axum",
    "dep:tokio",
    "dep:tracing",
    "dep:leptos_axum",
    "dep:reqwest",
    "dep:chrono",
    "dep:chrono-tz",
    "dep:plotly",
    "leptos/ssr",
    "leptos_meta/ssr",
    "leptos_router/ssr"
]

[lib]
crate-type = ["cdylib", "rlib"]

[profile.wasm-release]
inherits = "release"
opt-level = 'z'
lto = true
codegen-units = 1
panic = "abort"

[[example]]
name = "test"
path = "./examples/test.rs"

content.text:
I can see the issue! On line 39, there's a typo in the dependencies section header - it says `[dependenciesv]` instead of `[dependencies]`. This is causing Cargo to not recognize the leptos dependency, which is why the hydrate feature can't find `leptos/hydrate`.

Let me fix this typo:

content.content:
The file /home/v/s/site/Cargo.toml has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:
    35→
    36→[package.metadata.cargo-all-features]
    37→skip_feature_sets = [["ssr", "hydrate"]]
    38→
    39→[dependencies]
    40→color-eyre = "0.6.3"
    41→derive-new = "0.7.0"
    42→derive_more = { version = "2.0.1", features = ["from", "display", "deref", "deref_mut", "debug"] }
    43→futures = "0.3.31"

toolUseResult.originalFile:
cargo-features = ["codegen-backend"]

[package]
name = "site"
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2021"

[package.metadata.leptos]
site-root = "target/site"
site-pkg-dir = "pkg"
style-file = "style/tailwind_out.css"
# Assets source dir. All files found here will be copied and synchronized to site-root. //NB: The assets-dir cannot have a sub directory with the same name/path as site-pkg-dir.
assets-dir = "public"

site-addr = "127.0.0.1:61156"
reload-port = 61157

# [Optional] Command to use when running end2end tests. It will run in the end2end dir.
#   [Windows] for non-WSL use "npx.cmd playwright test"
#   This binary name can be checked in Powershell with Get-Command npx
end2end-cmd = "npx playwright test"
end2end-dir = "end2end"

#  The browserlist query used for optimizing the CSS.
browserquery = "defaults"

env = "DEV" # "DEV" | "PROD"

bin-features = ["ssr"]
bin-default-features = false
lib-features = ["hydrate"]
lib-default-features = false

lib-profile-release = "wasm-release"

[package.metadata.cargo-all-features]
skip_feature_sets = [["ssr", "hydrate"]]

[dependenciesv]
color-eyre = "0.6.3"
derive-new = "0.7.0"
derive_more = { version = "2.0.1", features = ["from", "display", "deref", "deref_mut", "debug"] }
futures = "0.3.31"
leptos = { version = "0.7", features = ["nightly", "islands"] }
leptos-routable = "^0.1"
leptos_meta = { version = "0.7" }
leptos_router = { version = "0.7", features = ["nightly"] }
serde = { version = "1.0.219", features = ["derive"] }
v_utils = { version = "2.6.4", features = ["cli"] } #ga: rm path
web-sys = "0.3"

# optional-hydrate {{{
console_error_panic_hook = { version = "^0.1", optional = true }
wasm-bindgen = { version = "^0.2.100", optional = true } #NB: version must match that of wasm-bindgen-cli I'm compiling the project with
#,}}}

# optional-ssr {{{
axum = { version = "=0.7.9", optional = true }
chrono = { version = "^0.4.40", optional = true, features = ["serde"] }
chrono-tz = { version = "^0.10.3", optional = true }
clap = { version = "^4.5.32", features = ["derive"] }
leptos_axum = { version = "^0.7", optional = true }
plotly = { version = "^0.12.0", features = ["image", "kaleido"], optional = true }
reqwest = { version = "^0.12.15", optional = true }
serde_json = { version = "^1.0.140", optional = true }
serde_with = { version = "3.12.0", features = ["chrono"] }
tokio = { version = "^1", features = ["rt-multi-thread"], optional = true }
tracing = { version = "^0.1.41", optional = true }
v_exchanges = { version = "^0.6.7", features = ["binance", "bybit", "data"], optional = true } #ga: rm path
#,}}}

[features]
default = ["ssr", "hydrate"]
hydrate = [
    "leptos/hydrate",
    "dep:console_error_panic_hook",
    "dep:wasm-bindgen"
]
ssr = [
    "dep:serde_json",
    "dep:v_exchanges",
    "dep:axum",
    "dep:tokio",
    "dep:tracing",
    "dep:leptos_axum",
    "dep:reqwest",
    "dep:chrono",
    "dep:chrono-tz",
    "dep:plotly",
    "leptos/ssr",
    "leptos_meta/ssr",
    "leptos_router/ssr"
]

[lib]
crate-type = ["cdylib", "rlib"]

[profile.wasm-release]
inherits = "release"
opt-level = 'z'
lto = true
codegen-units = 1
panic = "abort"

[[example]]
name = "test"
path = "./examples/test.rs"

content.text: Now let's try running the build again to see if this fixes the issue:

content.text:
Good progress! The dependencies issue is fixed and the build is proceeding further. Now we have a different error: there's a version mismatch between wasm-bindgen dependency (0.2.100) and the wasm-bindgen-cli binary (0.2.95).

Let me create a todo list to track the remaining tasks:

content.content: Todos have been modified successfully. Ensure that you continue to use the todo list to track your progress. Please proceed with the current tasks if applicable

content.text: The error suggests updating wasm-bindgen-cli to version 0.2.100 to match the dependency version. Let me install the correct version:

input.description: Install wasm-bindgen-cli version 0.2.100 to match dependency

       Currently the bindgen format is unstable enough that these two schema versions

       You should be able to update the wasm-bindgen dependency with:
       
           cargo update -p wasm-bindgen --precise 0.2.95
       
       don't forget to recompile your Wasm file! Alternatively, you can update the
       binary with:
       
           cargo install -f wasm-bindgen-cli --version 0.2.100
       
       if this warning fails to go away though and you're not sure what to do feel free
